title: ü§ñüìù Auto-document workflows with GPT-4o-mini sticky notes
description:
## ü§ñüìù Auto-Document Workflows with GPT-4o-mini Sticky Notes  

Skip the tedious part of writing documentation and turn your n8n workflows into **clear, shareable blueprints** ‚Äî fully automated.  

This workflow takes any workflow JSON, parses its nodes, generates structured sticky notes (both per-node and a general overview), and arranges them neatly on your canvas. No more messy layouts or missing documentation ‚Äî everything is handled in one click.  

It‚Äôs perfect if you want to **publish to the n8n marketplace**, onboard teammates quickly, or just keep your own automations easy to understand months later.  

---

## üí° What this workflow does  
‚úÖ Loads your existing workflow from a JSON file  
üîç Parses and unwraps real nodes (ignoring old stickies)  
ü§ñ Uses AI to create concise sticky notes for each node  
üìù Adds a general overview sticky with goals, flow, parameters, and gotchas  
üìê Arranges all nodes + stickies (node above, sticky below, right-to-left)  
üíæ Saves a new documented workflow JSON, ready to reuse or share  

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Step-by-step setup  

1. **Prepare your workflow file**  
   - Export your n8n workflow JSON or point to an existing file path.  

2. **Configure the ‚ÄúLoad Workflow‚Äù node**  
   - Update the file selector to your JSON path, e.g. `/workflows/myflow.json`.  

3. **Add your OpenAI credentials**  
   - In the *OpenAI API* nodes (`Node Sticky Notes` + `Overall Sticky Note`), insert your API key.  

4. **Run the workflow**  
   - Trigger manually with the `Execute Workflow` node.  
   - The script will parse your nodes, generate stickies, and align them on the canvas.  

5. **Save the result**  
   - The ‚ÄúSave Documented Workflow‚Äù node writes a new file, e.g. `/workflows/myflow-with-sticky.json`.  

---

## üõ† Customization  

- **Sticky layout:** Adjust spacing, colors, and alignment in the `Layout Blocks RTL` node (tweak `GAP_X`, `GAP_Y`, or `STICKY_COLOR`).  
- **Word count & style:** Edit prompts inside the OpenAI nodes to make notes shorter, longer, or more technical.  
- **Overview focus:** Customize the `Your Workflow Description` node to pass context (e.g., project goals, intended audience).  
- **File outputs:** Save to a new path/version for version control of your documentation.  

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Limitations / Gotchas  

- Maximum of ~50 nodes are summarized in the overview for brevity.  
- Old sticky notes are removed and replaced ‚Äî you can‚Äôt preserve them unless you fork the workflow.  
- Complex nodes (large Code / AI prompts) may require manual edits for clarity.  
- Ensure n8n has read/write access to your workflow JSON paths.  

---

## üéØ Expected result  

After execution, you‚Äôll get a **fully documented workflow JSON** where each node is paired with a clean sticky note, plus an overview note neatly placed on the canvas. You can open this new file in n8n, share it, or submit it directly to the marketplace.  

---

## üì¨ Contact & Feedback  

Need help customizing this? Have ideas for improvement?  

üì© **Luis.acosta@news2podcast.com**  
üê¶ DM me on Twitter [@guanchehacker](https://x.com/GuancheHacker)  

If you‚Äôre working on advanced workflow documentation + AI, let‚Äôs talk ‚Äî this template can be a foundation for more powerful tools.
disclaimer: This workflow is provided as-is. Please review and test before using in production.
